name: Samuel Darkwah Manu
intro: Welcome to my portfolio where I display web development, cartography and data science projects I have completed. You may find a few of them below but go to the projects page to see all. — currently a Research Assistant at the Institute of Cartography, TU Dresden.
about:
I am multifaceted IT professional with skills cutting across data science, cartography & geoinformatics and web development. I have expertise in building enterprise level reports and dashboards using Power BI and Tableau, performing analytics with Python libraries and geospatial tools.
 
I have a deep understanding of how the web works and can build fullstack applications with Vue.js, React, Node.js/FastAPI, relational (Postgresql, MySQL, SQL Server) and non-relational databases (MongoDB).
education: MSc. Cartography — TU Munich | TU Wien | TU Dresden | UTwente, Germany, Austria & The Netherlands
BSc. Development Planning — Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology, Ghana

projects.name: Accessible Map
projects.description: This project was developed as part of a master thesis in the International Master of Science in Cartography at TU Dresden. The master thesis topic is 'Accessibility Approaches for Thematic Web Maps'. The main objective of the thesis was to investigate how the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) can be applied to thematic web maps.

projects.name: OSM Accessibility Coverage
projects.description: This project visualises the accessibility of physical locations (buildings, shops, transport stations, etc) as a heat map based on OpenStreetMap data
